com.mlapadula.remember2

Class Remember

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mlapadula.remember2.Remember

  • public class Remember
extends java.lang.Object
    An in-memory data store backed by shared preferences. This is a key-value store with a few important properties:

    1) Speed. Everything is stored in-memory so reads can happen on the UI thread. Writes and deletes happen asynchronously (with callbacks). Every public method is safe to call from the UI thread.

    2) Durability. Writes get persisted to disk, so that this store maintains state even if the app closes or is killed.

    3) Consistency. Doing a write followed by a read should return the value you just put.

    4) Thread-safety. Reads and writes can happen from anywhere without the need for external synchronization.

    Note that since writes are asynchronous, an in-flight write may be lost if the app is killed before the data has been written to disk. If you require true 'commit' semantics then Remember is not for you.

    Created by Michael Lapadula (https://github.com/mlapadula)

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static Remember create(android.content.Context context,
                              java.lang.String sharedPrefsName)
        Creates a new instance of Remember
        Parameters:
        context - the context to use. Using the application context is fine here.
        sharedPrefsName - the name of the shared prefs file to use
        Returns:
        the instance that was initialized, or a cached instance if we already have one that uses this shared preferences file

      • size

        public int size()
        Gets the size of this collection.
        Returns:
        the size of this collection

      • keys

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> keys()
        Returns a Set view of the keys contained. Note that since this Set is a view of the underlying ConcurrentMap, the Set will have similar concurrency semantics. Ie, The view's iterator is a "weakly consistent" iterator that will never throw ConcurrentModificationException, and guarantees to traverse elements as they existed upon construction of the iterator, and may (but is not guaranteed to) reflect any modifications subsequent to construction.
        Returns:
        a Set view of keys contained

      • query

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> query(Remember.Predicate predicate)
        Queries for entries that match the given predicate, returning the corresponding keys. This is an O(n) operation on the contained map.
        Parameters:
        predicate - the predicate to apply to values
        Returns:
        the Set of keys for the matching entries

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears all data from this store.

      • clear

        public void clear(Remember.Callback callback)
        Clears all data from this store.
        Parameters:
        callback - the callback to fire when done. The callback will be fired on the UI thread, and will be passed 'true' if successful, 'false' if not.
